instruction: Based on this description of your genetic condition, provide a one-sentence summary to the anxious patient.
input: Hemochromatosis is a genetic disorder characterized by the excessive absorption and accumulation of iron in the body. Iron is an essential mineral that the body needs for various functions, such as carrying oxygen in the blood and aiding in the production of red blood cells. However, in hemochromatosis, the body absorbs too much iron from the diet and is unable to properly regulate its levels, leading to iron overload. There are two main types of hemochromatosis: Hereditary Hemochromatosis (HHC), and Secondary Hemochromatosis. Iron overload in hemochromatosis can lead to the deposition of excess iron in various organs, including the liver, heart, pancreas, and joints. Over time, this can cause damage to these organs and result in a range of symptoms and complications, such as fatigue, joint pain, abdominal pain, etc.
